title.content-text: 9.7.3 - The ARP Process - Removing Address Mappings

brief.content-text: The diagram depicts the use of the ARP process to remove address mappings. The diagram shows the same PC's and router as described in the previous diagram, but now PC C is removed from the network. If PC C's IP and MAC addresses are not removed from PC A's ARP cache, PC A may still try to communicate with C.
